meanings.definition: A ball of yarn or thread.
meanings.sent1: I found a clew of yarn in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She used a clew of thread to sew the button back on.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the clew, unraveling it all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The clew of yarn was like a colorful snake winding through the house.
meanings.sent5: The clew of thread was so tangled, it looked like a tiny maze.

meanings.sent1: The detective followed every clew to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: His sudden cough was a clew that he was hiding something.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious note left on the table was a clever clew to the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a bright clew that everything would be okay.
meanings.sent5: The old map provided a valuable clew to the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: To unravel or solve a mystery.
meanings.sent1: She tried to clew the puzzle of the missing sock.
meanings.sent2: The detective worked hard to clew the mysterious disappearance.
meanings.sent3: He cleverly clewed the riddle by following the clues.
meanings.sent4: The key evidence helped them clew the crime in no time.
meanings.sent5: They managed to clew the secret code and unlock the door.

meanings.sent1: The lighthouse clewed the ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent2: She clewed her friends through the maze to the exit.
meanings.sent3: The wise old owl clewed the young birds on their first flight.
meanings.sent4: His experience helped him clew the new employees in their tasks.
meanings.sent5: The map clewed them to the hidden waterfall deep in the forest.
